description:
8.70 bandreject
Apply a two-pole Butterworth band-reject filter with central
frequency frequency, and (3dB-point) band-width width.
The filter roll off at 6dB per octave (20dB per decade).

The filter accepts the following options:
name: bandreject

options.description: Set the filter’s central frequency. Default is 3000.
options.name: frequency

options.description:
Set method to specify band-width of filter.

h

Hz

q

Q-Factor

o

octave

s

slope

k

kHz
options.name: width_type

options.description: Specify the band-width of a filter in width_type units.
options.name: width

options.description: How much to use filtered signal in output. Default is 1. Range is between 0 and 1.
options.name: mix

options.description: Specify which channels to filter, by default all available are filtered.
options.name: channels

options.description: Normalize biquad coefficients, by default is disabled. Enabling it will normalize magnitude response at DC to 0dB.
options.name: normalize

options.description:
Set transform type of IIR filter.

di
dii
tdi
tdii
latt
svf
zdf
options.name: transform

options.description:
Set precision of filtering.

auto

Pick automatic sample format depending on surround filters.

s16

Always use signed 16-bit.

s32

Always use signed 32-bit.

f32

Always use float 32-bit.

f64

Always use float 64-bit.
options.name: precision
